cluster_relations.rel_desc: The prosecution of crimes is a legal process directed at crimes.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A process is performed on, directed at, or targets this entity as its primary object or input.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic scientists carry out and document every step of the forensic evidence analysis process.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: An agent or role carries out or executes a process or procedure.
remarks: Relation chosen to capture that scientists execute and record the process; could also be modeled as 'documents'.
Relation chosen to capture that scientists execute and record the process; could also be modeled as 'documents'.
Relation chosen to capture that scientists execute and record the process; could also be modeled as 'documents'.
Relation chosen to capture that scientists execute and record the process; could also be modeled as 'documents'.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Guilty individuals are accountable specifically for their actions.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject carries out, performs, or is responsible for the specified actions, behaviors, or processes.
remarks: Modeled as a generic performs relation to link individuals to their actions.
Modeled as a generic performs relation to link individuals to their actions.
Modeled as a generic performs relation to link individuals to their actions.
Modeled as a generic performs relation to link individuals to their actions.

args.canonical_rel_desc: An agent or role carries out or executes an action, behavior, or process.
args.justification: Both relations link an agent (forensic scientists, guilty individuals) to actions or processes they execute. They already share the same canonical predicate name 'performs' but had slightly divergent descriptions and different, overlapping relation classes ('process_agent_relation' vs 'behavior_action_relation'). Normalizing them to a single class 'agent_action_relation' and a unified, general canonical description improves schema consistency while preserving the AGENCY semantics.
args.remark: rel_cls_group remains AGENCY as already appropriate for both; only the intermediate class and shared description are standardized.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: An agent or role carries out or executes an action, behavior, or process.
executed_decisions.justification: Both relations link an agent (forensic scientists, guilty individuals) to actions or processes they execute. They already share the same canonical predicate name 'performs' but had slightly divergent descriptions and different, overlapping relation classes ('process_agent_relation' vs 'behavior_action_relation'). Normalizing them to a single class 'agent_action_relation' and a unified, general canonical description improves schema consistency while preserving the AGENCY semantics.
executed_decisions.remark: rel_cls_group remains AGENCY as already appropriate for both; only the intermediate class and shared description are standardized.
